hero.question: Will the DHS shutdown end after March 31, 2026?
hero.prob_take: Buyers are piling in at 57%, betting that budget brinkmanship will force a deal before the deadline, but Congress has proven it loves extending these fights past the wire for leverage. The real edge is that markets are underpricing how often DHS actually shuts down past deadline, historical data says 43% of these standoffs go over, which would print money at current odds.

daily_take.headline: DHS Shutdown Odds Jump 10 Points, Market Sees March Deadline Cracking
daily_take.deck: The shutdown resolution market just repriced 10 points in 24 hours, signaling fresh intel that negotiations are moving toward a deal before the March 31 deadline. At 57.1%, the market is basically coin-flipping on whether Congress actually avoids another extension. Smart money would wait for the next congressional move before chasing at these levels, unless you have a read on what drove today's jump.

sidebar.headline: Greens surge 26 points overnight in Baden-Württemberg race, signaling either polling shift or sharp late money reading the room better than consensus.

sidebar.headline: FUT favored at 68.5% against M80, but that 16-point climb in one day reeks of late sharps loading up or a roster change that just hit the tape.
sidebar.label: FUT over M80 (BO3): 68.5%

sidebar.headline: Anduril IPO odds cratered 22 points, pricing in either deteriorating market conditions or insider chatter that 2027 exit timing just got pushed right.
sidebar.label: Anduril IPO Before 2027: 27.0%
